description._content: By Frederick Hollyer (1837-1933) Sir James Matthew Barrie (1860-1937) was a Scottish dramatist and novelist. In 1883, he began his writing career at the Nottingham Journal, soon emerging as a novelist and playwright. His most famous work is Peter Pan (1904), which was based on the children in Barrie's life - and on himself. Frederick Hollyer ran a successful business photographing works of art.He set aside one day a week for portraiture at his studio in Pembroke Square, Kensington, London. Over a period of thirty years, he photographed friends and acquaintances from artistic and literary circles. We're happy for you to share this digital image within the spirit of The Commons. Certain restrictions on high quality reproductions of the original physical version of apply though; if you're unsure please visit the National Media Museum website. For obtaining reproductions of selected images please go to the Science and Society Picture Library.
